result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan G. Maresh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 16CM715.  Credit for 3 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $100.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Markie Donnellan, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Hold open agreement was previously revoked.  State is compliant with victim rights notification and sentencing arguments made.  Court imposes and stays 60 days in the KCJ w/ Huber and sentence is withheld; DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.  15CM1420 & 16CM715 are concurrent.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Court imposes a fine of $100 plus costs & surcharge.  Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied and if any bond remains it shall be applied to 16CM715.  If any unpaid financial obligation remains at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Markie D. unless permitted by the court.  Appeal Rights given.

Defendant Ryan G. Maresh appeared with Attorney Hilary D. Edwards.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.   Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   DE does not oppose the hold open agreement being revoked.   Court revokes hold open agreement and schedules case for sentencing.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:50 am.
to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement filed by ADA Binger
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement  kmk

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Hilary Edwards.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Entry of judgment withheld.  Hold Open Agreement for 12 months.  If successfully completed, State will recommend the case be dismissed.  Status conf. 1/31/17 at 8:30.  Bond continued.
At the request of Atty Edwards and with approval of Atty Binger, FPT on 1/28/16 at 9:10 is reset for 1/29/16 at 10:30.

156pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 09:20 am. $500 Continued Posted Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk
